#Text=Wikinews interviews producer of horror film ' 6:66PM '
#Text=Tuesday , August 1 , 2017
#Text=File photo of a film production clapboard .
#Text=Image : Runner1616 .
#Text=Wikinews recently caught up with screenwriter and film producer Chad Ridgely to discuss his latest indie horror film , 6:66PM .
#Text=The film is scheduled to show at the Buffalo Dreams Fantastic Film Festival in Buffalo , New York in November .
#Text=Interview
#Text=( ( WN ) ) I 've watched the teaser trailer .
#Text=Tell us about the film 's story line .
#Text=Chad Ridgely 6:66 P.M. is about a team of ghost hunters making a reality TV show about paranormal activity .
#Text=The problem is , none of them are really ghost hunters .
#Text=They stage the house to make it seem like the house they 're exploring is haunted , except it turns out that the house really is haunted by the ghost of a serial killer .
#Text=The serial killer is n't letting them get out of there without a fight .
#Text=He tries to kill them and take possession of their bodies .
#Text=So the crew is forced to try to capture some amazing footage for their show but at the same time avoid getting killed by this demon .
#Text=It has some scary moments , but at the same time it 's a comedy .
#Text=We tried to blend the two together for a nice mix of scares and laughs and I think we did a really nice job of it .
#Text=Many of us had worked together before so there was already a strong foundation in place and it let us play to everyone 's strengths .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Who is producing the film ?
#Text=CR
#Text=The film was produced by my company , Full Auto Films , and Code 3 Films , which is Jim Klock 's company .
#Text=Producers are Jim Klock , Chad Ridgely , and Darrell Martinelli .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Will you guys be making the rounds at film festivals soon ?
#Text=CR Yes , the film will world-premiere at the Buffalo Dreams Fantastic Film Festival in Buffalo , New York in early November 2017 .
#Text=We premiered our previous horror/comedy feature there , Massacre on Aisle 12 , last year and we absolutely loved it .
#Text=It 's a great festival and Buffalo is amazing .
#Text=I fell in love with the food there , especially the roast beef on weck sandwiches .
#Text=I think I gained ten pounds while I was there .
#Text=The food was that good .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Who wrote the script ?
#Text=CR
#Text=The script was written by Tommy McLaughlin and Chad Ridgely .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Where was the film shot primarily ?
#Text=CR We filmed outside of Atlantic City , New Jersey .
#Text=It was a little town called Egg Harbor City , which was a bit strange because I did n't see any eggs there , or a harbor , and the place was definitely too small to be a city .
#Text=They did have a fantastic diner , though .
#Text=We ate there every day before and sometimes after shooting .
#Text=I 'm beginning to see a pattern with food .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Have you signed any distribution deals ?
#Text=What are the hoped-for plans in terms of distribution ?
#Text=CR Yes , the film will be distributed by Indican Pictures in late fall of 2017 .
#Text=Indican Pictures also distributed our previous horror/comedy , Massacre on Aisle 12 , as well .
#Text=( ( WN ) ) Any weird or funny events happen during filming ?
#Text=CR Yes !
#Text=We lived in the set house while we were filming , and we were convinced the place was really haunted .
#Text=It was a secluded old farm house back in the woods , and late at night all sorts of weird things would happen .
#Text=For instance , the door to my room would slowly creak open all by itself while I was sleeping .
#Text=Jim Klock kept hearing footsteps creaking on the floorboards above his room , except there was no room above his .
#Text=It was just the roof .
#Text=There was also a very strange animal out in the woods that would make an incredibly creepy noise that we were never really able to identify .
#Text=And of course , no one was going out there to look .
#Text=In addition to scaring the crap out of us , it helped us bring additional authenticity to the film , which I think shows on screen .
